alert.note: Alert for Chester; Delaware; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 7:29PM EDT until July 28 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Central Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Delaware County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 729 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Honey Brook, or 8 miles southeast of New Holland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... West Chester, Phoenixville, West Norriton, Coatesville, Westtown, Downingtown, Parkesburg, Honey Brook, Elverson, Cheyney, Marshallton, Lima, Lionville-Marchwood, Gradyville, Valley Forge, Glenmoore, Paoli, Chester Springs, Newtown Square and Lionville. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 300 and 327. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 327. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
